meanings.definition: Cool (something) in advance of its use.
meanings.sent1: Before the picnic, we need to precool the drinks in the fridge.
meanings.sent2: I always precool the oven before baking cookies.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to precool the soup, but accidentally froze it solid!
meanings.sent4: She precooling her excitement before the big announcement.
meanings.sent5: The ice cream shop precooling their machines to make the perfect cones.

meanings.definition: The process of cooling something before it is used.
meanings.sent1: Precooling is important to keep food fresh in hot weather.
meanings.sent2: The precooling of the engine helped prevent overheating during the race.
meanings.sent3: The precooling of the ice cream truck made the children think it was a magic freezer on wheels!
meanings.sent4: The precooling of the ocean breeze brought relief to the sweltering beach visitors.
meanings.sent5: The precooling of the classroom made it a comfortable environment for learning.
